title: PUCSL flip-flops on orders given to CEB
content: Contradicting its own order, given on Monday (14), to the Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB) to manage the power crisis without power cuts for the next three months, the Public Utilities Commission of Sri Lanka (PUCSL) on Friday (18) approved power cuts to be enforced throughout the country.As a result, a one-hour power outage will be imposed between 2:30 p.m. and 6:30 p.m. in four separate groups.In addition, from 6:30 p.m. to 10:30 p.m., there will be a 45-minute power outage. PUCSL Chairman Janaka Ratnayake said the Commission has realised that electricity generators do not have adequate fuel to operate effectively. He stated that after withdrawing more than 400 MW of generators, the Commission is left with no choice but to impose a programmed power outage.
